title: Oswald Bear's Adventure
description: The darkness isn't as scary as we may believe. Discover the beauty of the night in this immersive journey through the Australian bush.
author: Diana Noonan
https://drive.google.com/file/d/19sY6FTqCEe3FUe81zGV1wingLJMvmdSa/view

content.caption: First room seen upon entering the room. The sound of the Australian bush at night can be heard and the stars twinkle overhead illuminating the room.

As the user walks forward following the footsteps on the ground the projections will trigger, showing a fish splashing on the wall. A sound of rippling water can be heard coming from the wall and fish scales can be touched allowing users to get up close and personal to the animal.
The next set of footprints light up as the projection finishes and goes dark. The user is now following the glowing footprints to the next room.

While following the footprints the user walks besides an interactive bush landscape, which has surprise interactions built in. Here a child is touching the fireflies that are floating around. They scatter and fly away from them.
The user reaches the next scene where an owl appears, it starts hooting and flapping its wings. It is glows brightly and has many enjoyable colours and details for children to look at.
Because they were intrigued the user goes up to the wall and starts interacting with the textures there. They can feel the owl feathers.
Users enter the interactive floor in the last section and will be guided by the bear on the display.

The user follows the footsteps to the final room, they find Oswald Bear sitting on the bench safe and sound as the sun rises above him creating a sense of closure to the night ending. Morning birds can be heard, and the user can touch the bear and rest on the bench if desired.
